title: Establishment of the Presidential Commission on the Supreme Court of the United States

enrichment.summary: This executive order establishes a Presidential Commission to study the role and functioning of the U.S. Supreme Court. The Commission, composed of up to 36 experts appointed by the President, will review historical and contemporary debates on the Court and provide a report with analysis and recommendations within 180 days.
potential_concerns: The Commission's recommendations could lead to significant changes in the Supreme Court that directly affect all U.S. citizens' rights and legal precedents, raising concerns among birthright and naturalized citizens about the stability of constitutional protections.
The study and subsequent reforms might politicize the Supreme Court further, potentially undermining public trust in the judiciary among diverse U.S. citizen groups.

As the Commission solicits public input, there may be disparities in who participates, possibly marginalizing voices from naturalized citizens and birthright citizens in less accessible or underrepresented communities.
Delays or controversies arising from the Commission's recommendations could create legal uncertainty, affecting U.S. citizens' confidence in the judicial system.
